alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 17 at 3:47PM PDT until June 17 at 5:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... North central Lincoln County in south central Nevada... * Until 545 PM PDT. * At 343 PM PDT, a dust channel was seen on satellite impacting Highway 93 north of Pioche to the county line. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind gusts in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Emergency Management and satellite observations. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel due to sudden reductions in visibility coupled with sudden strong wind gusts. In addition to rapid reductions of visibility, high profile vehicles could be blown over. This dust channel will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Lincoln County. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! To report severe weather, contact the National Weather Service, or your nearest law enforcement agency, who will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Las Vegas. There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles.
